dialogues.text: Yes sir. But this Treasury guy----it's gotten... complicated. He just shot somebody in Ozzie's house. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot----your analyst? Palmer shakes his head. PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozzie wasn't there. Our man surveying hears a gunshot, sees the Treasury guy wrestle something into his car, follows him; he dumps a body in the Chesapeake Bay. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well----what'd he do that for? PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know sir. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh for Christ sake. Anyone fish the body out? PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hm. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russian?   American? PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. Scrubbed of ID. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this... Linda...? PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda Litzke. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's Treasury? PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're----um... fuzzy on her. Gardner Chubb is flipping bemusedly through the contents the folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well----so----we don't really know what anyone is after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This analyst, ex-analyst, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    What's his clearance level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.    Okay, no biggie... He reaches the folder back to Palmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... for now just keep an eye on everyone, see what they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, sir. And----we'll interface with the FBI on this, uh, dead body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No, we don't want those idiots blundering around in this. Burn the body. Get rid of it. And keep an eye on everyone, see what they do. Report back when, um, I don't know. When it makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: A HOPPING MAN IN A UNITARD
dialogues.text: His hands are on his hips. He is darkly Mediterranean and very fit. He smiles into the camera as he hops in time to upbeat music, kicking a leg out on each beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the left!... Repeat!... To the right!... Repeat!... And in!... And out!... And higher!... Repeat!... Wider shows that the man is on TV leading the viewer in exercise. The viewer, in this case, is Osbourne Cox, on h boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows along in his underwear in the cramped quarters belowdecks. Boxes and luggage are strewn about, half- unpacked. He pants as he exercises:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm bigger... I'm back... I'm better... I'm back... than ever... I'm back... fuckers... I'm back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And good!... Repeat!... Now bend!... And bounce!... . And lower!... Repeat!... And up!... And back!... And up!... Repeat!

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: We are on a long lens point-of-view, from several cubicle over, of Linda slumped at her desk, head in her arms. We faintly hear her sobbing. Reverse shows Ted Treffon, the soulful manager of Hardbod looking at her, unsettled.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: We are in her cubicle now, her weeping bumping up at the A tap against the cubicle window brings her head up. Ted Treffon opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda.   You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, Ted, I'm sorry. He sits at the chair alongside her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no, I'm... I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't tell me what it's about. You never let me in, Linda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know you're trustworthy, I just... don't want to endanger other people with----I mean, it's a path I've chosen, it's not, you have to isolate, you know, a firewall. Ted sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Well, I don't know what to think. You both go AWOL on Friday; today Chad doesn't bother to come in at all---- LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Ted. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda, I can't run a gym this way. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Ted. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have to fire him. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No no no, Ted!   Just, just. .   .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me twenty-four hours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To what? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To, um... I don't know, twenty-four hours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda---- LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me twenty-four hours to solve this thing! TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda. I have to tell you. A man was here earlier asking about you. Yellow Revision 8/24/07 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda looks at Ted for a beat, thinking. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foreigner? TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda, are you in some kind of trouble? Is Chad running from something? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, we know what we're doing. Let me ask you this: did he know my name. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whuh----yes, he was asking about you. Employment history, et cetera. Real jerk. I told him to get lost. She takes his hand. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ted. Ted swallows.   He looks down. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we... Linda still has his hand.      He tries to cover his reac the physical contact. TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... we just don't give that out at Hardbodies. The phone beeps.    A voice comes through the intercom: VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda, there's a Mr. Krapotkin on line two. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omygod! She punches a button on the phone. LINDA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hello? Mr. Krapkin? VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda? Yellow Revision 8/24/07 87. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Ilan Krapotkin. Russian embassy. Returning your call. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes!----hang on.    Ted, I'm sorry. This is private. Looking at her, Ted sighs. He shakes his head sadly, rise and goes. Linda pushes the door of the cubicle shut with foot. LINDA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hello.     Is this a secure line, Mr. Krapkin?                                               * Beat. KRAPOTKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heh-heh. Another beat. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Krapkin?                                           * KRAPOTKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a secure, uh---- KRAPOTKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are joking? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I----I'm terribly worried about my associate. My----my----you know... Chad. KRAPOTKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?   Why is that? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have him? KRAPOTKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have him? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he----I don't know what the term is, did he, "go over"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Linda glances up. Outside her cubicle window Ted waits; a Linda's look he turns palms up: What's going on? Linda ho up a finger: one second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he not... at Hardbodies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I----look, can I come in and discuss this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry Pfarrer stands at the kitchen counter chopping carr He is intensely focused and chops very, very quickly, producing slices in high volume. Reverse shows Katie Cox in a chair in the living room, fr in a look up, a file of papers forgotten in one hand as s gazes over half-glasses at Harry. His chopping continues unabated. After a long look and much chopping:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still chopping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very distracted.      The last two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nn.   Work. The chopping continues. Katie's eyes shift down to the countertop, back up to Har Another beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... That's enough carrots, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? KATIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the salad? The chopping stops. Harry slaps the knife down.   He stares at Katie, jaw grinding, for a beat. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know: you're really a very negative person. KATIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What? Through grit teeth: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've tried. To ignore it.    And stay upbeat. Katie, unused to backtalk from Harry, is stunned.   She returns in a manner as hard as his: KATIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry: stop the foolishness. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the foolishness? KATIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And behave.    You are not talking to one of your... Her fingers form quotes: KATIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... "shithole buddies." Harry glares at her, vibrating with rage.   Her look at h equally hard. Harry abruptly turns and stomps up the stairs. Brief tromping on the second floor.   Katie sits in puzzl suspense. Footfalls descend the staircase. Harry reappears at the foot of the stairs with his wedge- cushion tucked under an arm. He flings the front door ope goes out, slams it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry stomps to his car in the driveway and flings in the cushion. He gets in, seething. After a beat he pulls out his cell phone and dials. A ring.   Pick-up.   A female voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey.    It's so good to hear your voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Yes. Can you come home?       Your baby needs you. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Can you please come home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, you know I----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can show you your present.     It's finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Harry.    I can't just leave the book tour. Harry sags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two days left.     There's still Seattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Yeah. Love you too. He folds the phone, miserable. As he pockets it his attention is caught by something in side-view mirror: The car parked across the street.    A man's shape in the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, jaw set, gets out of the car and starts down the drive. The parked car starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!    Fucker! The car tries to pull out but is closely hemmed in by car front and back; it will need a couple moves. Harry runs back to his own car, starts it, throws it into reverse and backs straight down the drive toward the frantically shuttling car. He t-bones it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucker! Harry, amped, throws his car into drive, pulls halfway up driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucker!   Fucker! He again throws the car into reverse. The man in the other car abandons his attempt to pull out scrambles frantically toward the passenger side. Harry again smashes into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other man emerges from the far side. He flees down th sidewalk as fast as his weight will permit, pocket change jingling, yelling as he runs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucker! Harry runs after him, calling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you work for?!   Who do you work for?! Pounding footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Tell me! The overweight man does not have Harry's stamina: Harry closes, leaps, and tackles. He crawls up the man's body, hand-over-hand, panting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Who do you work for? CIA?     NSC? The other man is panting much harder:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuchman Marsh! This stops Harry.   He isn't sure what he's heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuchman Marsh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Tuchman Marsh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name is... Tuchman Marsh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuchman Marsh Hauptman Rodino!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry stares at the man underneath him.     The gasping m explains: MAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I work for them! HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... work for Tuchman Marsh. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is a law firm. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! A rock band!      Yes, it's a law firm! HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... why are you following me? MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divorce action, numbnuts! Harry is blindsided.    He stares.   He slowly sits up, digesting: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My... my wife hired you?! The freed Tuchman Marsh man also sits up, still panting heavily. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Your wife hired Tuchman Marsh. Tuchman Marsh hired me. I work for Tuchman Marsh. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're----you're----a divorce detective. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just.     Credit, missing persons, whatever. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is divorce. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("duh") Well... yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry rises and walks stiffly, zombie-like, up the street The man watches him go. After a few paces Harry stops and sits on the curb.    He starts weeping. The man, still breathing heavily, calls out: MAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Jesus----grow up, man!    It happens to everybody! Harry's cell phone chirps.     He fishes it out and unfol sniveling. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, it's Osbourne Cox. Harry stares, trying to fit this in.     Osbourne prompts a silent beat: VOICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Harry? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? OSBOURNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, could I get your wife's number? This is Osbourne Cox, could I trouble you for your wife's---- HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't tell her anything she doesn't already know, fucker. OSBOURNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Harry again stares: maybe he has this figured wrong. After a silence: OSBOURNE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Is this... Harry Pfarrer? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want... Sandy's number? Echoing up the street:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I use your phone?   To call a tow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osbourne paces the cramped cabin belowdecks, a phone to h ear. He is unshaven, wearing a robe. Filtered rings, then a connection:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, it's Osbourne Cox, how are you. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Sorry to call out of the blue but I have a, well, a publishing question and I thought you might be the person to ask, I have this manuscript, something to do with my professional experiences, not to go into too much detail but I think it's pretty explosive stuff and I think that it could merit a fairly wide readership handled properly and it isn't quite finished yet but there's a situation where I'm worried about it leaking now and maybe excerpts being published or on the internet, whatever, without my permission, and a lot of the impact being, um, blunted, so I'm actually anxious to bring it to market sooner than I'd planned----I mean, like now, in fact----so I was thinking, I know you, and you seem to do well, so I was wondering if you were happy with your publisher. The people you use. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've written a children's book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No no, a, a kind of a memoir, but ----doesn't your company have an adult arm? Or isn't it, uh, the children's arm? Of a regular publisher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pappas & Swain do children's literature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. I see. So they don't---- okay... Are you well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well thank you.    And you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Good. Okay, well, thank you Sandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    Good talking to you. Disconnect. Osbourne yanks the rubber band off a bundle of mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two pairs of footsteps echo down a long hallway as Linda Litzke is escorted by a solemn Russian staffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waiting room.    A long beat; Linda sits waiting. A door opens.    Mr. Krapotkin emerges. Linda stands to go to the inner office but Krapotkin moti her back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, madam. Can we help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of Mickey Mouse embassy are you running?! I've been waiting here for fifty-five minutes, and I'm---- KRAPOTKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so sorry, madam.   An urgent matter. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well this could be urgent too, since, you know, Chad has been missing for forty-eight hours now and---- KRAPOTKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know the whereabouts of Chad, madam. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he was gathering information for you when he---- KRAPOTKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not interested in such "information". It was drivel. Linda is dumbfounded. A silent beat. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Dribble! Krapotkin fishes something from his pocket. KRAPOTKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like your disk back? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Dribble! Krapotkin stands with the disk extended toward her. KRAPOTKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry I can't help you. Linda recovers from her astonishment and is moved to outr LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what's dribble! You listen to me, Mr. Krapkin! I am---- Blue Revision 8/1/07 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking the opposite way. We hear two pairs of footsteps. They approach for several beats and then Linda and her escort enter frame and reced footsteps echoing. The staffer's hand is on Linda's elbow As we hold on their backs and they continue to walk, Lind jerks her arm away; the staffer regrabs it. She jerks awa again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exercise show plays on the TV, unwatched. Osbourne sit at a little table looking at a notice torn from a windowe envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What? He brings the notice close, squints at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What the fuck? He quickly shuffles through the rest of the mail, pulls o another envelope, rips it open.

dialogues.speaker: A MINUTE LATER
dialogues.text: Osbourne paces, drink in hand, staring at another piece o mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: A MINUTE LATER
dialogues.text: Osbourne is back at the table, drink half-consumed, liste at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes... No... Yes, I want to know why the check for my slip fee was returned for insufficient funds... Slip fee, for docking my boat, the check was returned... No, m'dam, it's not zero, I have about forty thousand dollars in that account... When? ... When?... But she can't do that----no, yes, technically it may be a joint account but she doesn't use it, it's not her money... No! No! What access, it's not possible! Without my permission? What about the, my, the, our savings account? My savings account?... I don't know the fucking number! You think I memorize the fucking numbers on my fucking bank accounts! Moron!... Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking at the exterior of the house in wide shot. Peaceful neighborhood. Birds chirp. From inside the house, though, we can faintly hear sobs, punctuated by sounds of exertion. Each gasp of effort end in a dull clang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wracking sobs bump up loud at the cut inside. Harry is weeping as he demolishes the love seat with a sledgehammer. Blue Revision 8/1/07 99A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted stares, horrified. After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-o-o-o-o-o way.   No way.   Whoa.   No way, Linda... She sits opposite him in his office.    Ted shakes his he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Ted, I can't do it, I don't know anything about computers.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Linda, the whole thing is crazy. It was crazy the first time, and you want to do it again? Break into the man's house? And why would----why would----you said the Russians didn't even want this stuff!

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: My world is bigger than that, Ted. There's other people. There's the Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Linda, these surgeries----

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: It's not just the surgeries, Ted! It's not just the money! We can use it as leverage! To get Chad back!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What do you mean "get him back"!

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: Information is power, Ted!     Hel-lo!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What do you mean "get him back"!      You don't know where he is!

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: Somebody has him.    And we can----

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: You ask the police to help you find missing people! And you----

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: I can't take it! I can't take it! I can't take it! You know I can't do that! We're operating off the map here, Ted! This is way higher than the police, it's higher than that!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Linda, I----

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: I need a can-do person, Ted! I hate your negativity! I hate all your reasons why not! I hate you! I hate you! Weeping, she storms out. Ted stares, shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In close shot, Ted sits onto a bar stool. Dim bar, tinkling piano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll it be. Ted stares straight ahead.     A long beat. He finally focuses on the bartender, off.      He swallow Another beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven & Seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night. Linda is asleep in her bedroom.        The buzz of house intercom. Linda stirs, wakes and reaches for the bedside phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurrow---- She removes an appliance from her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minutes later.   Harry is gazing off, slack-jawed, haunte After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think a marriage is... and then you... The thought drifts off.    A sad shake of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda enters, handing him a drink.    She sits opposite. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this was a long time coming. Harry looks up, surprised. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it? He catches himself.   His gaze wanders back to the haunte empty spot. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Well, yeah... right... LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're depressed, Harry. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hollowly) I am depressed. I gotta exercise. I haven't run in three days... butt- crunches... anything... Do you think I could stay here for a little while? Linda starts quietly weeping. This focuses Harry's attention.    He looks at her as if now noticing her. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What?    What's wrong, baby? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't always come from me, Harry! I'm not that strong! Harry moves next to her and puts an arm around her. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, baby?     Harry's here. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not here for me! I need a can- do person! You're all... defeated! HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, baby---- LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad is the only can-do person I know and he's gone, Harry, he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be good. I'll be better.     I just need to exercise. Are there pedestrian paths around here? He squeezes her shoulder, takes a gulp of the drink. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Who the fuck is Chad? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you help me find him?  He's a friend from work. You know law enforcement people, right? You could call, unofficially? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, what's his name?   What happened? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad Feldheimer. He just disappeared. He hasn't been at work or at home for two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He---- HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know his social security number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?     NO!    I---- HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. That's okay.     What's the last place you saw him? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snuffling) I don't know! He just disappeared! The last place I saw him was the Jamba Juice on K Street. And he's gone. Harry squeezes her shoulder again. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay baby. We'll find your friend. Missing person. Piece of cake.

dialogues.speaker: AN EPIGLOTTIS
dialogues.text: Illuminated by a small light. It quavers.       The tongu to rise and the mouth starts to close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, stay open... Wider: a pediatric examining room decorated with colorful prints of cartoon characters and clowns. Katie Cox, in a white smock, has a tongue depressor in a year-old's mouth and a light-sight in one hand. She withdraws both as the child finishes closing his mouth. T child's mother stands by. Katie grasps the child by the upper arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You have to let the doctor look in your mouth. The child keeps his lips pressed together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Now you listen to me, young man. You do as I say or I'll ask your mother to leave the doctor's office and the two of us will sort out what's what. The child looks at her fearfully. The wall phone bleeps. Katie rolls to it on her castored chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes. She listens briefly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... With a patient. She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osbourne, in dressing gown and pyjamas, is barking into t phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? The same patient she's been with since YESTERDAY? BullSHIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Cox has suggested you call her attorney----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, RIGHT! Tell her I got the new fucking keys! He slams down the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hatch is thrown open and Osbourne emerges from below. There is a large built-in toolbox just by the hatch. He yanks it open and pulls out a hatchet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New keys...

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: Osbourne strides grimly down the dock in his bathrobe, hatchet in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy Pfarrer is sitting in an armchair on a morning show living room set surrounded by a dozen eight-year-olds sit on the carpet. Hosts Del and Connie sit next to her in swivel chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it was just then----at that very moment----that Oliver sneezed----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can    we just----I'm sorry to interrupt but    we have to let the folks at home see    this illustration! Can we just get    a shot of that... He is holding the book open, face out on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There----there it is. Oliver. Interrupting the filibuster with----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's wonderful! DEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful! The book is "Point of Order, Oliver!" and the talented author is Sandra Pfarrer. We're gonna go to a station break and then be right back with Bud Fraighling, the Sultan of Salad, and Part Two of our special interview with Dermot Mulroney. So keep it where it is! Del and Connie and Sandy all wear smiles that stay fixed beat too long. Then Del relaxes and turns to Sandy. DEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Great segment. SANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. DEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know we thought it might be fun if you joined us with Bud Fraighling and help make the Fiesta Salad, when we move over. CONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over on the kitchen set. SANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't discussed. DEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure! No! Only if you want to! Your segment went great, we just thought---- SANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I made plans. DEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, great! CONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great to see you again, Sandra! She gives them a cold smile as a technician finishes unclipping her lavaliere and she leaves. Connie looks at Del and mouths "Bitch."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osbourne's crumple-backed car roars up. It cuts a corner the lawn and squeals to a halt in the drive. Osbourne emerges, still in robe and pyjamas, with the hatchet. He goes to the front door and bashes at the knob with the blunt end of the hatchet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New... fucking... keys... How's this for access... Hardware starts to fall off and jangle onto the stoop. Osbourne tries the sharp end of the hatchet a couple time decides he prefers the blunt end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... How's this for motherfucking access... More things fall off.    The knob wobbles in the door. Osbourne pushes the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy Pfarrer is accompanied by a bright young PR woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was way out of line. We were so unbelievably clear with them: just an Oliver segment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del and Connie are such putzes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine.     Thank you.   We're finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?   Well, okay. Great, uh---- Sandy, entered her dressing room, is already shutting the door on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside a man lounges reading a magazine.   He looks a lit like Harry but younger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought that would never be over. The man rises and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm.    Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me scrub this crap off my face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osbourne opens a cabinet, muttering:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for starters... He takes out liquor bottles and starts putting them in a packing case on the kitchen counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People sit on benches eating lunches. Harry Pfarrer is on the bench where he and Linda met, once again spitting sunflower seeds. Linda walks up.    They greet each other with a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello there sunshine.    You look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you seem better. Harry does indeed seem more like his old self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I snuck in a little gym time this morning. And our exercise last night didn't hurt! Linda is shocked but secretly pleased:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I am through banging my head against the wall. I am gonna start doing what's right for me. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how I believe, also.   You have to do what's right for---- HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Hell yeah! I mean I had a shock recently, and I realized you know, life is not infinite. No one's immortal. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's immortal. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to get from each day its full, uh, squeeze the juice from every day because there but for the grace of God---- LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. The important thing is to maintain a positive outlook. Always up. Always ebullient. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, don't sweat the small stuff... Linda chimes in: Linda and Harry HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and it's all small stuff. Harry reaches for Linda and she slides closer.     He put arm around her. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where we first met.   Remember? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I do. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know what the important days are, until... until, um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thought drifts away as his gaze fixes on something. his look still fixed: HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I told myself I was gonna stop being paranoid, but... is that guy looking at us? Linda follows his look. On a bench a short distance away a middle-aged man with aviator glasses and hair plugs is staring at them. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hastily) No, no. A slightly overweight woman stops tentatively in front of the man in the aviator glasses and they start to talk. Linda turns to Harry. LINDA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Have you found out anything about Chad? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing yet, I've made a couple calls. I don't think it'll take long. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, there are so many data bases now it's a joke... Relaxing now that he sees the man in aviator glasses enga in conversation, Harry warms to his theme. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Back when I was in PP there was still some art to finding people. Not any more. And now with the cell phones? Pretty soon they're gonna know where everyone is. Everyone. At any given moment. I mean it's almost the reality now. You would be amazed. LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he----when you left the Jamba Juice ----did Chad say anything about where he might be going? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know where he was going. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? LINDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A residence in Alexandria.    On Hillsboro Drive. Harry has stopped chewing.    He is staring at her. Linda feels obliged to fill the silence. LINDA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... 2055 Hillsboro. Harry stares.    Linda doesn't know what to make of his f stare. LINDA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It's, um. The residence of a guy named Osbourne Cox. Harry is beginning to look sick. A long silence. Then, quietly: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? Now Linda stares, unsure of what to make of the question. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: ... WHO ARE YOU
dialogues.text: Linda's eyes widen.   She is a little frightened. People nearby turn to look.   It is a scene. HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: ... WHO DO YOU WORK FOR
dialogues.text: Harry reaches up.    He grabs her by the shoulders and sh HARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda is at sea.    She answers in a small voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ... just ... Linda Litzke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry stares at her. A long beat. He leaps to his feet and looks around in a panic. His point-of-view, sweeping the park. Nearby, the man wit plugs, though talking with his date, is looking at him ag Farther away, a man sits in a curbside sedan. Watching? Hard to say. Harry turns and runs.       Linda gapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Harry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osbourne sets the packing box heavily      down on a bure upstairs bedroom. The box is a third       loaded up with bottles. It also holds a mixed drink       which Osbourne takes out. The ice cubes clink as he       sips, poking t things in the bureau. One drawer holds scarves and accessories and a large case He opens the case and starts dumping jewelry from it into cardboard box. Suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!   Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He yanks his hand back and shakes it.      He looks at th of his thumb. He sucks it. He carefully picks a brooch out of the jewelry case and flings it across the room. He resumes dumping jewelry into his box. He suddenly stops: A faint knock.    The front door. Osbourne waits. The knock repeats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another beat. The front door creaks open. Osbourne carefully sets down his drink. He steps quietly the closet and pulls a small cedar chest off a high shelf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda flings open the door to her car parked on the stree bordering the mall. She gets in and turns the ignition. Pulling into traffic she checks her rear-view, and her lo snags on: A dark four-door sedan pulling out a few cars back. It fa in behind her. Its driver is a man in sunglasses. He reaches up and touches fingertips to one ear. Linda frowns.   She looks forward, glances again at the mirror. Another dark car pulls into the lane next to the first. driver is also a man in sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downstairs, Osbourne rounds the corner from entryway to living room, a handgun at the ready. His drink is in his other hand. Ice cubes clink as he moves. The living room is empty. Osbourne advances cautiously.     A quick sidelong look a kitchen. Empty. He proceeds to the basement door.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA DRIVING
dialogues.text: She gives worried glances at her rear-view. The light ahead turns yellow, red. Cars ahead stop.   Linda stops. A rhythmic thudding sound.    It almost makes her car vib

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around.   She rolls down her window, sticks her out, looks up. A black helicopter hovers overhead, rotors thudding. A bl clad body leans partway out. The person seems to be looki down. Linda draws her head back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh for Pete's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osbourne is slowly descending the stairs, gun and drink i either hand, gun up, ice cubes clinking. The basement comes slowly into view. Someone stands behind his desk, at the computer. Osbourne descends further. He stops on the bottom step an stares at Ted Treffon, the soulful manager of Hardbodies. Ted stares at him. A long silence between the two men. Then, quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are... my wife's lover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what are you doing here. Silence. Osbourne takes the last step down.    He advances slowly, trained on Ted. Osbourne's look, holding on Ted, changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I know you. You're the guy at the gym. Ted licks his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not here representing Hardbodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSBOURNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you represent. You represent the idiocy of today. Ted shakes his head. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't represent that, either. OSBOURNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes. You're the guy when I went to ask about that moronic woman. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not---- OSBOURNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in league with that moronic woman. You're part of a league of morons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. OSBOURNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You're one of the morons I've been fighting all my life. My whole fucking life. But guess what. Guess what. Today I win. BANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Ted is shot in the upper chest. He grabs a three-hole punch from the desktop and flings i Osbourne and charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! BANG----another shot goes off. Ted barrels into Osbourne, knocking him over----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Oooph! ----and goes on past him, lumbering up the stairs. Osbourne gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Stop!     Intruder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted staggers out of the house, a hand pressed to his ches He has reached the front lawn when Osbourne emerges, robe flapping, pursuing with the hatchet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intruder! He quickly catches up to Ted and whacks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Osbourne whacks him down.       He keeps whacking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gardner Chubb is behind his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Palmer DeBakey Smith is seated across from him.      He f A beat. Gardner Chubb rubs his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Wait a minute. Where's the treasury guy? Pfarrer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a detention room at Washington Dulles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was trying to board a flight to Venezuela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PALMER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had his name on a hot list, the INS pulled him. Don't know why he was going to Venezuela. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no extradition with Venezuela. PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Uh-huh. Well----what should we do with him? GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For fuck's sake, put him on the next flight to Venezuela! PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.     Okay. Gardner Chubb is weary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.      So the gym manager is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. GARDENER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body is----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay---- PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But----there was a, uh... snag...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What. PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. This analyst, Cox, was attacking the gym guy. It was broad daylight, on the street. Our man there didn't know what to do. He felt he had to step in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He, uh... He shot the analyst.      He shot Cox. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!    Great! Is he dead? PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir. Gardner Chubb grimaces. PALMER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He's in coma. They're not sure whether he'll make it. They think, they're pretty sure he has no brain function. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. If he wakes up we'll worry about it then. Jesus, what a clusterfuck. That's it then. No one else really knows anything. Okay. PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um.     Well sir, there is... GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What. PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What. PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is the woman.   The gym woman. Linda Litzke. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.   Fuck. Where is she. PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We picked her up.    We have her. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we, uh----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She, she, she says she'll play ball if we pay for some... I know this sounds odd----some surgeries she wants. Cosmetic surgery. She says she'll sit on everything. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much. PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were several procedures.    All together they run to, um---- GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay it. PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Should I pay it out of, should it be from---- GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the black accounts, I don't give a shit. The January fund. Whatever. PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.    Jesus fucking Christ. He shakes his head. GARDNER CHUBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What did we learn, Palmer. PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, sir. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fucking know either. I guess we learned not to do it again. PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. GARDNER CHUBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although I'm fucked if I know what we did. PALMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.    Hard to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull back from Gardner Chubb, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.   Jesus fucking Christ.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: We pull up, back through the clouds, away.
